It's super-trendy and there's always someone to take that empty seat, so it seems that customer service has been deemed not of the essence.
It can be a very fun experience with a group, and kids (6 and over) would love it.
I felt as though I were eating in Paris.
You will pay a lot for the decore, but the food is no better or worse than a lot of other Chinese and Asian fusion places in NY.
And I could do without the cigar smoke.
This place is the most Japanese it can ever get.
The ceiling is amazing!
Right off the L in Brooklyn this is a nice cozy place with good pizza.
A cool place to hang with your friends for a couple of healthy drinks and desserts.
Metrazur has a beautiful spot overlooking the main terminal.
They are often crowded on the weekends but they are efficient and accurate with their service.
They also have a back garden open in the summer - cute and French with outdoor seating - what more could you ask for?
The atmosphere was crowded but it was a great bistro-type vibe.
There's nice and quiet, small but enough for 6 (or more).
Always popular, always full, always a wait.
Seating is ok even though sometimes there's alot of people.
It is kinda nosiy and the tables are close together but it's still a beautiful place to enjoy a nice dinner.
The place does get crowded, so I recommend going between 4-5 PM.
The restaurant is a bit noisy but that is something that can be overlooked once you sit down and enjoy a great meal
And even with it's Pub atmosphere they were great to my kids too!
Forget the rush and the wait and the noise (which isn't actually that bad), I mean please, who goes to a steakhouse to be coddled and romantic?
The decor is very simple but comfortable.
Of course, it is crowded but who cares.
Great roofdeck, nice group of 30 somethings, but no music, kind of quiet.
Decent Thai food in cute - though a bit dank - little Nolita hangout, BUT service terrible.
Inside is a little cramped, but to be expected.
Traditional French decour was pleasant though the hall was rather noisy - the restaurant was full and we had to raise our voices to be able to maintain a conversation.
